intro: Galium junceum, commonly known as silverweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It features slender, upright stems that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are opposite, narrow, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium junceum is commonly found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks.
